snippet: Security researchers have developed quick online tools to detect whether a machine has been infected with Gauss, the virus that has been stealing log-in credentials for e-mail, social networks, instant messaging and bank accounts, predominantly in...
abstract: Security researchers have developed quick online tools to detect whether a machine has been infected with Gauss, the virus that has been stealing log-in credentials for e-mail, social networks, instant messaging and bank accounts, predominantly in Lebanon.

headline.main: Got Gauss? Tool Helps Spot Lebanon-Focused Virus on PCs
